column4: I'm setting up ubuntu for the first time on a home theatre PC... I am not sure how to get ubuntu to recognize my USB RF wireless keyboard...
does it require certain drivers--try plugging it in
it comes with drivers on a CD, but it was plug-and-play on Windows XP
plug in the base station and see if it works
how does the wireless connect? to the cpu? likely to a dongle that you plug into a usb port, yes?
yes it is a USB dongle.  It is listed in my hardware information screen
It sees a Wireless Keyboard/Mouse in my USB UHCI Controller #2
try syncing it with the keyboard--there should be buttons on both base station and keyboard that may need to be pressed simultaneously
so it works now? if it is recognized then just try using it--othewise try the sync
I'll try to sync... the button isn't clear.... one says ID...
no luck yet.  Thanks for your help btw :)
It is the SpecResearch 01027; although the box actually says X-Gene :-P
the writer of that article seems to suggest that it is no prob with ubuntu
yeah... hmm :(  I guess I'll just keep tinkering.  Thanks for the help though.
